body_html:
@qlzh727 Thank you for pointing out that, I can confirm that this issue had been fixed with the tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-devel-gpu-py3 docker image.

I think we have another repository inside Google and the latest code is not synced with GitHub in time, am I right?

If so, I'd like to suggest that we should keep them automatic in sync so that we can see the latest code.

Have a nice day!
body_text:
@qlzh727 Thank you for pointing out that, I can confirm that this issue had been fixed with the tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-devel-gpu-py3 docker image.
I think we have another repository inside Google and the latest code is not synced with GitHub in time, am I right?
If so, I'd like to suggest that we should keep them automatic in sync so that we can see the latest code.
Have a nice day!
body:
@qlzh727 Thank you for pointing out that, I can confirm that this issue had been fixed with the `tensorflow/tensorflow:nightly-devel-gpu-py3` docker image.

I think we have another repository inside Google and the latest code is not synced with GitHub in time, am I right?

If so, I'd like to suggest that we should keep them automatic in sync so that we can see the latest code.

Have a nice day!
